context.p: After the AUT is defined, you need to install the event tracking agent in your application, provide the development environment and associate the test project.
Select the AUT you want to configure. The configuration menu appears with three installation steps.ATG Configuration menu

info.p: A developer or someone with access to the codebase of the AUT must add the tracking code snippet provided by Katalon. The code snippet should be pasted into the <HEAD> element of the HTML code of the AUT. Once the code snippet is added, the AUT should be saved, built, and deployed to the production environment.

It is important that the tracking code is added correctly to collect data from all user interactions. This will allow the Katalon AI to collect and model user journeys accurately and generate test cases.

Click on the Add Test Environment button. In the opened dialog, you need to provide the test environment for the test execution. You can name the environment, specify its URL and provide login credentials for accessing that environment if necessary.

Katalon AI will explore the test environment following the paths identified from user activities on the production environment and generate test cases accordingly. This activity will ensure the test cases generated can be later executable on the test environment.

step.info: Click on the Link Project button to specify the test project and script repository. The test cases will be committed and pushed to the script repository, which can then be executed as Katalon test scripts. Link project dialog

taskbody.result: The application under test is configured for autonomous test generation.
